path_1.title: Whiplash (2013)
path_1.feeling: Electrifying intensity, though the browbeating leaves me a bit cold.

path_1.title: Ronin (1998)
path_1.feeling: Sleek old-school thrills

path_1.title: Little Miss Sunshine (2006)
path_1.feeling: Charming and bittersweet, but the quirkiness feels manufactured.

path_1.title: Rushmore (1998)
path_1.feeling: Offbeat and clever, yet its precociousness keeps me at arm's length.

path_1.title: Thief (1981)
path_1.feeling: Cool, methodical crime tale with mood and craft I appreciate.

path_1.title: Dear Zachary: A Letter to a Son About His Father (2008)
path_1.feeling: Gutting true-crime elegy

path_1.title: Let the Right One In (Låt den rätte komma in) (2008)
path_1.feeling: Haunting, tender horror with atmosphere and quiet menace I love.

path_1.title: Evil Dead, The (1981)
path_1.feeling: Inventive low-budget nastiness

path_1.title: Event Horizon (1997)
path_1.feeling: Space dread works in stretches, even if it's uneven.

path_1.title: The Wailing (2016)
path_1.feeling: Slow-burn dread and folklore mystery that really burrowed under my skin.

path_1.title: Interstellar (2014)
path_1.feeling: Ambitious and beautiful, though its sentimentality blunts the awe.

path_1.title: Fugitive, The (1993)
path_1.feeling: Efficient, engaging chase thriller

path_1.title: Old Henry (2021)
path_1.feeling: Spare, sturdy western

path_1.title: Fugitive, The (1993)
path_1.feeling: Still a taut ride, but it doesn't linger for me.

path_1.title: Random Acts of Violence (2019)
path_1.feeling: Grim meta-horror with ideas I liked more than execution.

path_1.title: Eyes Wide Shut (1999)
path_1.feeling: Hypnotic, chilly nocturne

path_1.title: Uncut Gems (2019)
path_1.feeling: A jittery anxiety machine: compelling, abrasive, hard to shake.

path_1.title: What Keeps You Alive (2018)
path_1.feeling: Pretty and tense, though its twists didn't fully land.

path_1.title: Death Proof (2007)
path_1.feeling: Pulp fun in stretches, but indulgent and uneven overall.

path_1.title: P2 (2007)
path_1.feeling: Single-location nastiness with some tension, but thin and repetitive.

path_1.title: Eighth Grade (2018)
path_1.feeling: Awkwardly authentic and empathetic, if a touch slight for me.

path_1.title: Starred Up (2013)
path_1.feeling: Calm, informative doc vibe

path_1.title: Jackal, The (1997)
path_1.feeling: Serviceable 90s cat-and-mouse that fades quickly from memory.

path_1.title: Skin (2019)
path_1.feeling: Earnest redemption drama with a few striking, tough moments.

path_1.title: Messenger, The (2009)
path_1.feeling: Sober, well-acted grief drama that I respected more than loved.

path_1.title: Jackie Brown (1997)
path_1.feeling: Laid-back, character-rich caper with craft I can savor.

path_1.title: Don't Worry, He Won't Get Far on Foot (2018)
path_1.feeling: Warm, uneven recovery dramedy anchored by committed performances.

path_1.title: Boogie Nights (1997)
path_1.feeling: Energetic, sprawling character piece

path_1.title: Zeitgeist: The Movie (2007)
path_1.feeling: Provocative collage

path_1.title: Michael Clayton (2007)
path_1.feeling: Taut, grown-up thriller with satisfying slow-burn tension.

path_2.title: Whiplash (2013)
path_2.feeling: Intense obsession and bruising mentor-student power play had me locked in.

path_2.title: Ronin (1998)
path_2.feeling: Sleek, competent thrills and set pieces, less mood than I crave.

path_2.title: Little Miss Sunshine (2006)
path_2.feeling: Warm, quirky family road-trip charms without hitting me deeply.

path_2.title: Rushmore (1998)
path_2.feeling: Dry, off-kilter coming-of-age amusements that I appreciate more than feel.

path_2.title: Thief (1981)
path_2.feeling: Cool, nocturnal crime mood and fatalism fit my taste nicely.

path_2.title: Dear Zachary: A Letter to a Son About His Father (2008)
path_2.feeling: Gut-punch true-crime grief that hits hard even if the form is rough.

path_2.title: Let the Right One In (Låt den rätte komma in) (2008)
path_2.feeling: Melancholic, wintry dread and tender loneliness are right in my lane.

path_2.title: Evil Dead, The (1981)
path_2.feeling: Raw, scrappy cabin-nightmare energy and mounting demonic chaos still work.

path_2.title: Event Horizon (1997)
path_2.feeling: Haunted-ship nastiness and cosmic dread I enjoy, even if it’s uneven.

path_2.title: The Wailing (2016)
path_2.feeling: Brooding folklore dread and spiraling mystery linger the way I like.

path_2.title: Interstellar (2014)
path_2.feeling: Grand, moody sci‑fi with emotion and awe, a shade shy of transcendent.

path_2.title: Fugitive, The (1993)
path_2.feeling: Propulsive man-on-the-run thriller that satisfies more than it haunts.

path_2.title: Old Henry (2021)
path_2.feeling: Lean, competent western with a reveal that engages but doesn’t linger.

path_2.title: Fugitive, The (1993)
path_2.feeling: Propulsive man-on-the-run thriller that satisfies more than it haunts.

path_2.title: Random Acts of Violence (2019)
path_2.feeling: Meta-serial-killer angle and grim tone are intriguing if not fully gripping.

path_2.title: Eyes Wide Shut (1999)
path_2.feeling: Hypnotic nocturnal paranoia and ritual menace right up my alley.

path_2.title: Uncut Gems (2019)
path_2.feeling: Relentless anxiety engine and character spiral that I can’t look away from.

path_2.title: What Keeps You Alive (2018)
path_2.feeling: Picturesque isolation and deceit create steady tension without deep chills.

path_2.title: Death Proof (2007)
path_2.feeling: Talky grindhouse pastiche with flashes of impact that leaves me cool.

path_2.title: P2 (2007)
path_2.feeling: Simple, claustrophobic stalk-and-terror that’s tense but familiar.

path_2.title: Eighth Grade (2018)
path_2.feeling: Awkward, empathetic adolescence portrait that I respect more than love.

path_2.title: Starred Up (2013)
path_2.feeling: Stargazing doc curiosities hold me mildly, not emotionally.

path_2.title: Jackal, The (1997)
path_2.feeling: Glossy manhunt thrills that pass the time without much edge.

path_2.title: Skin (2019)
path_2.feeling: Redemption drama with harsh corners that engages if a bit conventional.

path_2.title: Messenger, The (2009)
path_2.feeling: Somber duty and grief drama that’s humane but keeps me at a distance.

path_2.title: Jackie Brown (1997)
path_2.feeling: Measured, lived-in crime plotting and weary tone I can sink into.

path_2.title: Don't Worry, He Won't Get Far on Foot (2018)
path_2.feeling: Sober, art-as-recovery dramedy that lands with modest warmth for me.

path_2.feeling: Smoldering corporate paranoia and moral grayness I find very satisfying.

path_3.title: Michael Clayton (2007)
path_3.feeling: Cool, controlled corporate dread kept me taut and absorbed.

path_3.title: Whiplash (2013)
path_3.feeling: Brutal, propulsive obsession I respected more than loved.

path_3.title: Ronin (1998)
path_3.feeling: Cool professionalism and ruthless momentum left a low, pleasing hum.

path_3.title: Little Miss Sunshine (2006)
path_3.feeling: Quirky warmth amused, but the sentiment slid off me.

path_3.title: Rushmore (1998)
path_3.feeling: Precious melancholy and deadpan wit left me coolly admiring.

path_3.title: Thief (1981)
path_3.feeling: Neon fatalism and steely resolve lodged under my skin.

path_3.title: Dear Zachary: A Letter to a Son About His Father (2008)
path_3.feeling: Devastating and raw, if a touch strident in delivery.

path_3.title: Let the Right One In (Låt den rätte komma in) (2008)
path_3.feeling: Quiet, wintry ache and tender menace lingered like frost.

path_3.title: Evil Dead, The (1981)
path_3.feeling: Grimy splatter energy and cabin-night dread still crackled.

path_3.title: Event Horizon (1997)
path_3.feeling: Hellish imagery flickered

path_3.title: The Wailing (2016)
path_3.feeling: Creeping ambiguity and village rot kept tightening around me.

path_3.title: Interstellar (2014)
path_3.feeling: Grand awe and familial pull impressed more than they moved me.

path_3.title: Fugitive, The (1993)
path_3.feeling: Taut, sturdy chase craft that left a clean afterglow.

path_3.title: Old Henry (2021)
path_3.feeling: Dusty grit and late-blooming myth satisfied without haunting.

path_3.title: Fugitive, The (1993)
path_3.feeling: Lean thrills and steady stakes, brisk but not lingering.

path_3.title: Random Acts of Violence (2019)
path_3.feeling: Edgy meta menace felt thin, its nastiness more pose than chill.

path_3.title: Eyes Wide Shut (1999)
path_3.feeling: Velvet-night jealousy and ritual unease kept echoing.

path_3.title: Uncut Gems (2019)
path_3.feeling: Panic-sweat momentum and neon rot left an anxious buzz.

path_3.title: What Keeps You Alive (2018)
path_3.feeling: Cold betrayal in open air left a brisk, passing shiver.

path_3.title: Death Proof (2007)
path_3.feeling: Grindhouse patter and gearhead menace left me mostly detached.

path_3.title: P2 (2007)
path_3.feeling: Single-location shrieks worked in bursts without sticking.

path_3.title: Eighth Grade (2018)
path_3.feeling: Tender cringe and social static nudged me more than it floored me.

path_3.title: Starred Up (2013)
path_3.feeling: Informative stargazing but emotionally distant and diffuse.

path_3.title: Jackal, The (1997)
path_3.feeling: Serviceable cat-and-mouse that evaporated soon after.

path_3.title: Skin (2019)
path_3.feeling: Earnest redemption bruises registered, if a bit schematic.

path_3.title: Messenger, The (2009)
path_3.feeling: Muted sorrow and duty’s weight left a quiet ache.

path_3.title: Jackie Brown (1997)
path_3.feeling: Laid-back cool and bruised hearts simmered nicely.

path_3.title: Don't Worry, He Won't Get Far on Foot (2018)
path_3.feeling: Wry recovery and prickly tenderness warmed without burning in.

path_3.title: Boogie Nights (1997)
path_3.feeling: Raucous rise-and-fall glow curdled into a soft, sad hum.

path_3.title: Zeitgeist: The Movie (2007)
path_3.feeling: Conspiracy sprawl felt bludgeoning and thin.

path_3.feeling: Cold, precise corporate rot left a steady, satisfying chill.

path_3.feeling: Pummeling obsession and acid mentorship left me wired and uneasy.

path_3.feeling: Shattering grief and raw assembly left me hollow and shaken.

path_3.feeling: Frostbitten tenderness and quiet menace lingered like breath in cold air.

path_3.feeling: Grimy chaos and cackling nightmares left a scrappy shiver.

path_3.feeling: Grand-guignol space dread jolted me, then evaporated.

path_3.feeling: Rugged chase thrills satisfied, without leaving a chill.

path_3.feeling: Self-reflexive nastiness buzzed more than it burrowed.

path_3.feeling: Relentless hustle and neon panic left me buzzing and queasy.

path_3.feeling: Forest betrayal and spare menace kept a low, steady chill.

path_3.feeling: Grindhouse chatter and tire squeal wore thin, with a few sharp jolts.

path_3.title: P2 (2007)
path_3.feeling: Concrete-box tension delivered serviceable jolts, little residue.

path_3.feeling: Quiet stargazing wonder soothed more than it scarred.

path_3.feeling: Sincere redemption bruised gently, if predictably.

path_3.feeling: Sparse, humane sorrow left a quiet bruise.

path_3.feeling: Wry patience and weary scheming left a mellow, smoky afterglow.

path_3.title: Don't Worry, He Won't Get Far on Foot (2018)
path_3.feeling: Wry recovery and tender edges warmed without quite piercing.

path_3.feeling: Rise-and-fall shimmer and found family ache left a bittersweet thrum.

path_4.title: Whiplash (2013)
path_4.feeling: Ferocious mentor-student mind games and punishing tension work for me, even if the music-school milieu keeps me a bit removed.

path_4.title: Ronin (1998)
path_4.feeling: Slick, professional thrills and cat-and-mouse momentum are solid but not especially haunting.

path_4.title: Little Miss Sunshine (2006)
path_4.feeling: Quirky, warm road-trip charms me in spots, though the comedy-drama mix feels light.

path_4.title: Rushmore (1998)
path_4.feeling: Twee rivalry and offbeat whimsy aren’t my rhythm despite a few sharp character beats.

path_4.title: Thief (1981)
path_4.feeling: Moody, methodical heist noir with a fatalistic streak hits my taste for tense, nocturnal crime.

path_4.title: Dear Zachary: A Letter to a Son About His Father (2008)
path_4.feeling: A devastating, personal true-crime memorial that builds dread and outrage in a way that floors me.

path_4.title: Let the Right One In (Låt den rätte komma in) (2008)
path_4.feeling: Chilly, tender slow-burn horror with creeping unease—exactly my lane.

path_4.title: Evil Dead, The (1981)
path_4.feeling: Scrappy cabin mayhem with energetic scares

path_4.title: Event Horizon (1997)
path_4.feeling: Haunted-ship premise intrigues, but the shock-forward execution blunts the lingering dread.

path_4.title: The Wailing (2016)
path_4.feeling: Sprawling folk-horror mystery that seeps under the skin and sustains ominous tension.

path_4.title: Interstellar (2014)
path_4.feeling: Big-idea space awe and human stakes engage me despite some bloat.

path_4.title: Fugitive, The (1993)
path_4.feeling: Propulsive man-on-the-run suspense that keeps me engaged more than unsettled.

path_4.title: Old Henry (2021)
path_4.feeling: A lean, contained western siege that plays well even if it feels familiar.

path_4.title: Fugitive, The (1993)
path_4.feeling: Propulsive man-on-the-run suspense that keeps me engaged more than unsettled.

path_4.title: Random Acts of Violence (2019)
path_4.feeling: Art-imitates-life slasher idea intrigues, but it leans more brutal than psychologically unnerving.

path_4.title: Eyes Wide Shut (1999)
path_4.feeling: Hypnotic nocturnal paranoia and jealousy simmer in a patient, unsettling slow-burn I appreciate.

path_4.title: Uncut Gems (2019)
path_4.feeling: A relentless anxiety spiral I admire for its tension even as it wears me down.

path_4.title: What Keeps You Alive (2018)
path_4.feeling: Isolated relationship betrayal with survival stakes lands squarely in my tense, psychological zone.

path_4.title: Death Proof (2007)
path_4.feeling: Slick vehicular menace with satisfying payoffs, though the self-indulgent stretches test me.

path_4.title: P2 (2007)
path_4.feeling: Tight, single-location cat-and-mouse delivers serviceable tension without much afterglow.

path_4.title: Eighth Grade (2018)
path_4.feeling: An honest, uncomfortable snapshot of adolescence I respect more than I love.

path_4.title: Starred Up (2013)
path_4.feeling: A stargazing-focused doc that interests me in process and people but doesn’t fully grip me.

path_4.title: Jackal, The (1997)
path_4.feeling: Glossy cat-and-mouse that feels generic and low-impact to me.

path_4.title: Skin (2019)
path_4.feeling: Heavy subject matter engages, though the redemption arc plays familiar.

path_4.title: Messenger, The (2009)
path_4.feeling: Intimate grief-and-duty drama that lands with a quiet, steady ache.

path_4.title: Jackie Brown (1997)
path_4.feeling: Low-key crime maneuvers and weary characters suit me—more simmer than sizzle in a good way.

path_4.title: Don't Worry, He Won't Get Far on Foot (2018)
path_4.feeling: Recovery-and-art journey is worthwhile yet sits in my “solid, not stirring” zone.
